snippet: The boys were both 15, with the crackly voices and awkward peach fuzz of adolescence. They lived just a few minutes away from one another in the West Bank. And both were accused of throwing stones at vehicles, one day after the other....

headline.print_headline: In West Bank, Teen Offenders Face Different Fates
headline.main: In West Bank, Teen Offenders Face Different Fates

lead_paragraph: The boys were both 15, with the crackly voices and awkward peach fuzz of adolescence. They lived just a few minutes away from one another in the West Bank. And both were accused of throwing stones at vehicles, one day after the other.
